intro: Campanula loretiana, commonly known as the Loretta bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in racemes, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Campanula loretiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
